scenarioDescription:
The HD 109749 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 109749 is a star with 1.13 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.22 times its radius. It is located 205.75 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 109749 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 109749 system


HD 109749 b

HD 109749 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2006-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 109749 b is 85.860 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 109749 b is 11.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 109749 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 109749, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 109749 - System With 1 Exoplanet
